label: 龍門
本: Sugawara no Michizane and the Early Heian Court . University of Hawai'i Press . 1994
説明文: This was the name of a turbulent rapids on China's Yellow River.  Any fish able to swim up it was thought to become a dragon.  Consequently, to pass the dragon gate" came to be a fixed metaphor for passing the equally challenging civil service examinations (pp. 127-8). "
